storyInfo: Grace looks for a childhood friend amongst the refugees after receiving a call for help. She tries to help them, but her highborn status becomes an obstacle. She is forced to make a choice, as she was fated to as an Arizona.

attributes.content: Arizona Manor, North Rockbrook, County of Toron
Ahem...
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Letter for you, Miss Grace.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Miss Grace is changing.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: She's been sneaking out almost every day while her parents are away. Shouldn't we do something?
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Well, you could start by chopping down the tree outside the window. If you expect me to do something about it through her clothes though, I assure you I've tried everything.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: I haven't seen you try anything.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Perhaps you should see an eye doctor then, Mr. Counsell.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Letter for you, Miss Grace.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Leave it on the table.
Aren't you going to read it?
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: No need. I can more or less guess what it's about.
The typical greeting, then asking after my parents, then regretfully declining my request with some excuse or other...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: The young Vulpo sits before the dresser, dolefully fidgeting with the receiver in her hands, the indicator light on it flashing red.
She would have been overjoyed if it had flashed yesterday, or the day before.
*sigh*...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Maybe I shouldn't be wasting my time writing these letters or reading the responses.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: When will Father and Mother return? I should be ready to greet them.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Oh, I'm terribly sorry! We were so busy downstairs that I forgot to tell you.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: His Lordship sent word that he and Her Ladyship have been invited to a bookstore's opening ceremony. A well-compensated appearance, I'm told.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: He would have been better off using his pen name. No doubt it's worth even more than the title of Baron Arizona.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Well, he used to write some awfully cynical things under that name, so he stopped using it once he became The Right Honourable Henry Arizona.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Better safe than sorry, after all. Who knows how many nobles were involved in what he criticized?
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: So he gets to choose his identity, while I'm forced to accept the life he decided for me.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Wait, so how long is this delay?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: A day.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: If I didn't know any better, I'd think that grin meant you were planning to sneak out again.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Sorry, I just remembered something urgent!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Miss Grace!
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Temporary accommodation site, Rockbrook outskirts, County of Toron
Near the forests, where civilization meets wilderness, a group of despondent people have been abandoned.
The wet morning mist fades away, and the sun's rays shine into the dark grey forest.
Guys, I'm back!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: You again? What is it this time? Like this place isn't messy enough already.
attributes.name: Grumpy Old Man

attributes.content: Do you remember the health information I asked you for last time?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Right, four days ago. Haven't seen your face since.
attributes.name: Grumpy Old Man

attributes.content: Well, I couldn't get back to you because—
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Because we couldn't hold up our end of the deal? You wanted information on Marianne, and you thought we were hiding something, so you left us hanging to see if we'd loosen our tongues.
attributes.name: Grumpy Old Man

attributes.content: Settle down, friend. She's not your foreman, she's just a little girl. Why would she be playing tricks like that?
attributes.name: Gentleman

attributes.content: Don't judge a book by its cover. Who knows what lies beneath the surface?
attributes.name: Grumpy Old Man

attributes.content: You do owe us an explanation though, young Vulpo. Why did you need our health information?
attributes.name: Gentleman

attributes.content: Like I said, I asked many doctors, and only one didn't reject me out of hand.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: He said if I got your personal information—to learn more about your health—then he could come and help.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Unfortunately, he was out when I brought him the data, and hasn't been back to his office in a few days...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: What a coincidence!
attributes.name: Grumpy Old Man

attributes.content: Let her finish.
attributes.name: Gentleman

attributes.content: ...So all I could do was wait, and keep searching for another way.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I did place a transmitter on the door to his clinic though, so I'll get a signal when he opens it! Look, this red light has been blinking since morning.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: What are you doing here then? Shouldn't you be off looking for him?
attributes.name: Gentleman

attributes.content: I wanted to get updated information, since I'm not sure if the reports from four days ago are still recent enough... I don't know much about this, I just thought it would be safer this way.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Pull the other one. You only wanted news about Marianne, you never really cared about us. Why should we trust you?
attributes.name: Grumpy Old Man

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: You don't need to answer him. He's still under the delusion that the nobles will come and help us.
attributes.name: Gentleman

attributes.content: Phooey! Of course they will! They just don't know about our situation yet.
attributes.name: Grumpy Old Man

attributes.content: Marianne's been missing for quite some time. No matter how much effort you devote to helping us, we can hardly conjure her out of thin air.
attributes.name: Gentleman

attributes.content: I know that. I'm not too worried about her. It's more important to focus on the here and now.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: She's a child, same age as you. Who knows what could happen in the forest?
attributes.name: Gentleman

attributes.content: I knew her before I moved here, and we used to sneak out and play together. She loves plants, and there are enough in there to keep her from going hungry at least.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Her first letter asked me to take care of you, and I'd rather she not nag me when she gets back, so...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Well, no matter what anyone else says, I'm on your side. I'll help you persuade them too, if it comes to it.
attributes.name: Gentleman

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Why don't you start your info gathering with me then? I need to go cut some wood once we're done here.
attributes.name: Gentleman

attributes.content: What for?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: We want to build a bigger house, to fit everyone. Things will get better.
attributes.name: Gentleman

attributes.content: Yes, they will.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Siew Clinic, Rockbrook, County of Toron
An old office lies near the town walls. Grace was last here four days ago, and the dust in the corner has only grown thicker since then.
The windows are covered in grime. They once faced the entire town; now, the melody of industry converges on the west ones only.
A small man sits before the table, muttering in some foreign tongue peppered with a few Victorian words.

attributes.name: Doctor
attributes.content: The bill...

attributes.name: Doctor
attributes.content: The bill...

attributes.name: Doctor
attributes.content: The bloody bill!
Ahem—
We're booked for today.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I got what you asked for.
The doctor looks up with a start. The frames of east windows cast long, trapezoidal shadows.
A Vulpo stands at his door, her golden hair glittering in the sun.
Here. I've organized them.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: ...You really did it.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: How did you compile these reports? You're just a child.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I have some medical books at home. I like to flip through them whenever I get grounded.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Just for reference, though. I'm sure there are still plenty of mistakes.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Well done... Well done indeed...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Your turn.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: About that...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I have to visit the Pelham Manor today. Can we talk about this after I get back?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The name Pelham strikes Grace like a bolt of lightning.
An ominous sign.
Why?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: My patients do expect me to visit them.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I meant, why do I have wait until after you visit her?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: So... this really is about her?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: You're not her private doctor. She lives in the nomadic city, only visiting here once a month to supervise the factory. Why does everyone do as she says?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: It's not that simple.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You're under her thumb. Just like everyone else.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: She doesn't control me.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But things are an awful lot easier with her support, aren't they?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Listen, girl.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: To them, I'm a luxury, something fashionable, a lifestyle, value added. That's the foundation on which my life and my family are built. I can't turn my back on it now.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: My rent, my child's tuition, my wife's Oripathy treatment... I can't afford to lose this job.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: This isn't one of those fairy tales where you can defeat the evil and everybody lives happily ever after. The true enemy is formless. It's a byproduct of living. It's life itself.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: And how is helping these poor people at odds with a noble's interests?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I'm not Her Ladyship. I can't see the full picture.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: They're just ordinary, harmless people you'd find anywhere.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: And if they're really so unimportant, do you think they'd be treated this way?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: As for other nobles, I doubt any of them would risk getting on the wrong side of the daughter of a newspaper mogul who married into the Pelham family and owns a number of factories.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I'm almost out of free time, Dr. Siew. It was only by happy accident that I could make it today. I wanted to make the most of this spot of luck, along with the hope you gave me.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: If I haven't done enough, then tell me, and I'll keep trying.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: And what exactly have you done?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I asked many people for help.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: So you're placing all your hopes on others.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I suppose you're right...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I'm in no position to criticize you. However—
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I envy you. You have both talent and innocence. Your motives are simple. You're young, energetic, passionate. Life hasn't yet pulled the trigger on you.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But why not do it yourself? What are you so worried about?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: My family may not approve. Or the Pelhams. Or the people of the town...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Hold on, back up. You're just a child. You shouldn't feel bound by such matters. Don't think about it like that.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Listen...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The night I made my promise to you, I wrote to her and mentioned it. She hinted that luxury is a complicated thing, taking its value from many sources.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: For example, it would be worthless if it were given away to the poor for free.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: She implored me not to lose sight of my 'consumers.'
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: She threatened you.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: It wasn't a threat. She didn't need to. It was a reminder. Even if were to become a right bastard, it wouldn't affect her one way or another.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: ...Although I suppose I already am.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I gave you false hope, and now I have to be blunt...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I'm sorry, but I only made that promise because I didn't think a child like you would really try to help them.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: So you wanted to refuse from the beginning, but couldn't say it to my face?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I'm sorry I got your hopes up.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Do you know the Arizona family? I'm... friends with their daughter. Would you agree to help if she asked you directly?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: If you're friends with a noble, that's all the more reason not to view them so simply.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The Arizonas have no stake in this, so they have no reason to butt heads with the Pelhams.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But those people are dying. Shouldn't they care? What about honor?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Nobles are nobles because they're recognized as such. But they don't need the recognition of commoners, just other nobles.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Honor is simply an accessory adorning their power and wealth.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But what if the Arizonas aren't like other nobles? I'm really close to their daughter, I know they're different!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Face it, they're all the same.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Did you think Lady Arizona and the baron were really in love?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Their marriage was based on mutual interest, as most of theirs are. One side gained social status, the other gained powerful Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I don't think they're any different from other nobles. If anything, they're still struggling to find their footing, making them all the more conservative.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Are you saying my—
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Are you saying the baron and baroness are...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: She could not go on. Logic and syntax break apart, along with something deep inside her heart.
Like the snow castles that Counsell built for her, helplessly waiting for the changing of seasons.
Melted snow fills her eyes.
It's getting late. I have to hurry to Pelham Manor, then go into town to deal with the mess my son caused at school.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I'll write if anything comes up.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I apologize. You're young... but you're honorable.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I... I'll find someone else.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Town Park, Rockbrook, County of Toron
*sigh*...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Ladies and gentleman, I say again, I found this man cutting down our trees!
attributes.name: Unfamiliar Townsfolk

attributes.content: He is destroying our property!
attributes.name: Unfamiliar Townsfolk

attributes.content: Today they cut our trees, tomorrow they'll take our food, then our jobs, then our land!
attributes.name: Unfamiliar Townsfolk

attributes.content: Defend our property! Defend our jobs! Defend our town!
attributes.name: Unfamiliar Townsfolk

attributes.content: Defend our property! Defend our jobs! Defend our town!
attributes.name: Mob

attributes.content: What are you doing?!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: No, Miss Grace!
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Counsell? What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: That man has ties to the Pelham family. He'll recognize you.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: But I know the man they have tied up! I have to help him!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Let me go!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Miss Grace... there are people here who know you. That makes you a daughter of the Arizonas, and your every word and deed that of your family's.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Your status does not permit you to interfere.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: What if I say I don't care?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Your servants at home do. They have livelihoods and families. They need steady jobs.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Look at these people. They've never cared about the trees before.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Lady Pelham is most shrewd. She's made the townsfolk despise these people from the bottom of their hearts. Made her will theirs.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Step forward now, and you put Arizona at odds with the entire town.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: This is a complicated matter. If you truly want to intervene, you had best wait for His Lordship to return. They won't keep him tied up for long; it's risky, even for them.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Please, calm down. I must answer to your father.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Your aunt did not know that your parents were going to be late. She's already on her way here, and we will be welcoming her as planned.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: We couldn't very well turn her away... All the servants have their hands full. We had no choice but to simplify the menu and courses.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: And since we have a guest, we require a hostess. I came to bring you back.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: ...Apparently, Miss Grace Arizona has more important matters to attend to.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Please come with me. The manor needs you.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.text: His head is bowed, but Grace could feel his piercing gaze, like a sword running her through.
A sorrow far too deep for a girl her age spreads inside her.

attributes.content: Arizona Manor, North Rockbrook, County of Toron
Not this one... This one's no good either...
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: This one...
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Why not the previous one?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: You've been so busy lately that your skin has lost some sheen. I need to find something that can make it shine.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Our guest will be arriving in but a few minutes. We should be at the entrance to greet her.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Don't rush me, Mr. Counsell!
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Here, this one!
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: 'Miss Grace' does not respond. She leans back in her chair, gazing out the window, while the servants line up to greet the guest.
She casts her gaze towards the town factory as it energetically churns out black smoke in the distance.
It is quiet.
Neither summer nor winter have come as promised.
Her gaze returns to the dresser. The letter that came that morning still lies there.
I mended this dress just this afternoon. Look at the sequins I sewed on!
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Are you finally reading the letter? I'll fetch a letter opener.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: No need. I already have it open...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Mr. Counsell! Stop Miss Grace!
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: *Pant* I-I'm out of breath... *pant* hurry...
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Have the new manservant clean this up.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Out of my way!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: The banquet is about to start, Miss Grace. As a servant of the Arizonas, I can't let you run around like this.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: What is this about?
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: I said out of my way!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: What happened? I can't decide whether to obey unless you tell me.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: A Messenger went into the forest and found some...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: There was a girl was carrying a pile of letters. Nothing written on them, except the sender and recipient. I'm the recipient, and the sender was...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Marianne... it was two weeks ago.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: ...My condolences, Miss Grace.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: It's all my fault.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I assure you it is not. I witnessed your efforts with my very own eyes.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Did you now? And what precisely have I done?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: From the very beginning, I knew nothing of what they were dealing with.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I could empathize with their suffering, but only on the surface. I just assumed someone would help them, that it would get better.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: For the past few months, all I've done is play the role of the young lady of the house, while writing a few letters in my spare time. None of which amounted to anything.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: But when I finally met them directly these past few days, I realized that what I had empathized with was less than a fraction of their real pain and suffering.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: They need help, Counsell. They shouldn't end up like Marianne.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: It's not your place to do so. You're the daughter of the Arizonas.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: This isn't the place to stand on status. We're all equal before such suffering.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Do the baron and baroness know of this?
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: No. I was afraid they would be angry, and make it even harder to do anything.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Perhaps you could tell them once they return.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: I heard something about Father and Mother today.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I don't think they're any different from the people I wrote to, seeking help...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Love and kindness are mere illusions when it comes to nobles... even Dr. Siew lied to me.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: But at least he suggested to go among them and check up on their health, to give them some basic advice about medicine.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I even noticed that some of them had gotten better when I visited them today.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: That sort of thing is what's really worth doing... to me, at least.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Why should I wait for others to act? I can't entrust these people's lives and hopes to others. I can't keep fooling myself and putting things off.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Miss Grace, we should wait for your parents to—
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: How long am I supposed to wait?!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: My friend is dead! While she was struggling on the brink of death, I was busy socializing, busy watching my words, busy managing Arizona's relationships with other nobles!
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Do I have to stay at home, asking for help in proper, dignified, useless ways, while I watch those who trusted in me get lynched?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Is nobility meant to be a shackle, Counsell?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Maintaining proper etiquette in your social life is all for the sake of the Arizona family's honor and reputation. If it can regain its former glory, it can shine its light on yet more people.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: They don't have the time. Neither do I.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: They were forced to wander because they lost their land. And they'll die slowly while I enjoy the comfort of high society, just as Marianne did...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: What's the point of it all, if the favor of these nobles has to be earned at every turn? If I can bring them back to health, they'll light their own torch, find their own way in the darkness.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Miss Grace...
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Counsell. I'm not angry at you.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I just needed to vent, like how some people turn to drinking or hunting.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I need to do something. I can't live like this without changing.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Let me do something useful, in what few days I have.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Very well, then. You should start by reading these then.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: These are...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: From the manor library. You remember them, don't you? The baron's translation, which you've flipped through so many times.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: There will always be little details that slip your mind, of course. Bring them along for reference.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Counsell...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I've seen this play before. I can't stop you.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: I'll tell them I couldn't catch you. Just don't let it slip that I let you go on purpose.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Hold on, Miss Grace.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: You're not going back on your words, are you?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I visited Dr. Siew to retrieve the trinket you 'forgot' on his door.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: He told me that if I ever saw the young lady's Vulpo 'friend,' I should tell her that he most definitely did not forget to close the clinic's window, and certainly did not leave various medicines and supplies on the table.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: There will be no hiding your little sojourn. Have you thought about what you'll do when your father returns? I doubt arguing will help the matter.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: I'll apologize. I'm not ready to argue with him yet.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Be careful, and keep your identity a secret.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Thank you, Counsell.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Is Miss Grace still in the library?
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Yes. It's like she's a whole different person.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: I only regret that I might have cost you your job.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: My job? Miss Grace has been spending her days in the library rather than sneaking out. Why would I lose my job?
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: A single meaningful journey is worth a thousand frivolous trips. She's not the little girl she once was.
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Thank goodness for that.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: Aren't you concerned?
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: If that's her choice, then her light shouldn't belong to me alone.
attributes.name: Maid

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Her light, is it?
attributes.name: Butler

attributes.content: Counsell gazes to the west and sees the light of the setting sun fall on the floor of the Arizona Manor.
Old memories rise to the surface.
She's your daughter alright, Henry.
attributes.name: Butler
